lead_paragraph: The ownership of the Breeders’ Cup Classic winner Curlin has changed again. Jess Jackson bought out another partner and now has an 80 percent interest in Curlin, a 3-year-old colt. Jackson, who owns Stonestreet Stables, bought out the investment banker George Bolton. Jackson’s spokesman Kevin McGee would not provide details. Curlin is the favorite to be named Horse of the Year in 2007.
